description: The colonial expansion of European powers all over the globe was linked to all manner of scientific developments. The geological, geographical, botanical, zoological and human characterists of subject terriroties were new subjects of scientific inquiries, undertaken largely but not exclusively to assess the resources colonialists might exploit either in the metropoles or in settlements abroad. These inquiries proved powerful stimuli to scientific work in the metropoles, encouraging both disciplines formation and the multiplication of scientific roles. This course considers these and kindred topics.
name: SCIENCE & COLONIALISM
